No problem at all, ask questions as and when you can and I'll check in from time to time :grin:

So, with your example, your rig structure needs to be the same consistently, and not differ in order. So for example, if your original rig's joint order is 1>2>3 then your second rig needs to be 1>2>3. You can  add additional joints at each level so as long as 3 is parented to 2, you can also add for example 2a, 2b etc.

            2a
So 1 > 2 > 3 would be what the structure should be in terms of hierarchy
            2b

You're also fine to add on to the end of the chain, so 1>2>3>4 and the rig would still work. There'd be no animation data for 4, but the animation existing for bone 1-3 would work fine.

With your example, as long as the hierarchy was the same for the joints, from head to toe, then only the extra joints would not be able to share animation data. You could even make use of that informatino data deliberately, say you wanted to retargeting animation from somethings legs but have a totally different upper body. You would keep the legs the same structure wise and then do whatever it is you needed to do for the spine upwards.

Hope that helps, this slide show has a good explanation of these principles, I know Uncharted 2 is a slightly older game at this point, but we're just building on top of ideas like this, and a lot of studios aren't in the position to implement ideas as complicated as this even now. (it is Naughty dog after all). <https://www.gdcvault.com/play/1012552/Uncharted-2-Character-Pipeline-An>
